lines.text: Alright, then. It looks like we’ve got the basic facts of the case down, finally.
That crook Slick Emmup tried to rob these wizards, but ended up burnin' to death.
There's also a dead Go Wizard, who got shot AND got set on fire. It looks like the bullet was the cause of death.
On top of that, it looks like the Stop Wizard cast a spell here- Livin' Memory, to make an illusion of what happened.
Then he tried to cast Flesh to Stone on the robber, to finish him off... but since the robber was on fire, it counted as a status effect, and the Stop Wizard turned to stone.
But… there’s a couple suspicious details we still haven’t figured out.
Like: how did the fire start? And why didn't Slick escape before getting burned alive?
Hmph. I don’t think it matters, does it?
Huh?
You know what happened, don’t you? Why don’t you just- just file your report, already?
I honestly don’t think we need to spend- spend too much more time in this, this hole in the wall.
...Is that so?
Seeker, we’re not done here. Is there anything else catchin' your eye?
Heh. I see what you mean. The whole fire situation is pretty ‘spish.
...spish?
‘Spish! Like, short for ‘’suspicious’’!
Maaaaaa!
...I see.
So the whole fire angle on the situation is way ‘spish.
Plus, you said the landlord heard a <c=#FF00FF>gunshot</c> at 2:10- but the <c=#FF0000>fire</c> didn’t start until 2:35.
That’s ‘spish, too! What was happening for all that time?
I don’t know, but I'm orderin' you right now to never say ‘’spish’’ again.
Buzz off, Leo! You’re not the boss of me!
I’m literally the boss of you.
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Bleh. Friggin’... killjoy… wise guy.</f>
Suspiciousness aside- and you better pay me back for the cost of all those syllables- this can’t be the whole story.
If not because of all the open questions, then because of how there’s like, a zillion pieces of evidence we still haven’t used!
There’s no way this game has that many red herrings.
...Game?
I mean, case. Whatever.
Anyway, Leo, we doing this the same as before? You have questions, I come up with answers?
This… this really isn’t necessary. Can’t we just go home?
Maaaaaa!
I’m decidin’ that maaa means ‘’no’’. Get back to work!
